articles.title: 'My father was lynched by vigilantes but today I stand proud'
articles.description: When E.W. Higginbottom was 3, his father was dragged from his cell by a mob and hanged from a tree as a crowd cheered on. Today, he is remembered with thousands of other African Americans as the country's first national memorial to lynching victims opens.
